metadata.title: CVE-2022-20567 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
In pppol2tp_create of l2tp_ppp.c, there is a possible use after free due toa race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege withSystem execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-186777253References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required
